values: <lj-template name="qotd" id="331"></lj-template>I don't think it was the right thing to do.  I'd like to think people who make decisions in this country have enough backbone to fucking stand up for what they do.  He wanted girl ass like most other guys one the planet - which doesn't make him a bad person, and didn't effect his ability as a politician.  Some people play Jenga or something on their nights off, and others fuck women for joy?  I don't see the harm, and particularly not the reason he should have had to resign.  Ask his wife what she thinks, since it affects her more than the country?

<lj-template name="qotd" id="330"></lj-template>A virtual toolbox of Swiss army knives, keys, Zippo lighter, space pen, 8GB flash drive, hankerchief, mints, wallet with mirror in it, tape measure, business cards, lip balm.  Just everything tiny I can stuff in my pockets?  It's not too uncommon to find a bit of rope there, and I usually strap on a Leatherman in the morning?

I write the words of a god in a language no man can read.
I author fables and tales so complex to be indecipherable,
yet so childishly simple.  
They branch and grow and recurse in a lively dance
and crescendo to to the same towering end.
True or false, pass or fail.

It's the journey that is truly wonderful in my stories.
Yet no person ever takes that journey.  
No person ever sees the sights along the way.
No person appreciates the elegance of the plot.
The outcome is always the same, uninteresting.
I am an invalid artist.

I think of you sleeping in my arms.  
Feeling you move against me.
Sleeping.
Just stirring.
Restless.
yet resting with me, quietly.
Trusting.

Your soft sighs of remembering me mixed with your thoughts in sleep.
Feeling your movements and wondering what you must be thinking.
What your dreams are made of.
Who you really are.
Why you care so much.
Admiring you for learning still, while you sleep with me.

I dare not move to wake you.  
I'm careful.
holding you.
Just being with you.
feeling your body against my chest.
Your breaths swell against me.
Tiny noises I hang on.
Just listening to you.
Just being with you.

I count the minutes watching the clock across your soft shoulders.
In the darkness.
Illuminating you.
Waiting for it to count down the moments.
Until I can kiss you awake.
My arm is numb beneath you
I bear it.
I bear your sleep
I bear your breath whispering to me.
The smell of your hair
the scent of your skin.
The sound of your breath as you inhale
pushing me slightly away
and relaxing to let me fall back against you.
The heat of your skin against mine.
Warm and comforting.

I move my arm to nestle between your breasts.
To hold your chest in my hand.
Softly, I pull you to me.
A gentle hug.
and you stir against me.
Wondering.
Listening.
Your eyes still closed, I kiss you good morning.
softly.
and hold you to me.
very close.
...lots of things to say, but no direction yet.  Give me some time to think about it.
